meanings.definition: The state or quality of being permeable.
meanings.sent1: The permeances of the sponge allowed the water to flow through easily.
meanings.sent2: The fabric's permeances made it ideal for breathable clothing.
meanings.sent3: The permeances of the sieve turned it into a magical water filter.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a permeances that touched everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The permeances of the forest floor made it a perfect habitat for many creatures.

meanings.definition: The ability to allow liquids or gases to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The permeances of the membrane allowed the gas to diffuse across.
meanings.sent2: The permeances of the soil determined how well it could absorb water.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's permeances made it the favorite at the party.
meanings.sent4: His words had a permeances that spread through the room like a fragrance.
meanings.sent5: The permeances of the wind carried the scent of flowers far and wide.
